title: Duties of guardian
context: ยง560:5-207 Duties of guardian. (a) Except as otherwise limited by the court, a guardian of a minor ward has the duties and responsibilities of a parent regarding the ward&rsquo;s support, care, education, health, and welfare. A guardian shall act at all times in the ward&rsquo;s best interest and exercise reasonable care, diligence, and prudence. (b) A guardian shall: (1) Become or remain personally acquainted with the ward and maintain sufficient contact with the ward to know of the ward&rsquo;s capacities, limitations, needs, opportunities, and physical and mental health; (2) Take reasonable care of the ward&rsquo;s personal effects and bring a protective proceeding if necessary to protect other property of the ward; (3) Expend money of the ward that has been received by the guardian, for the ward&rsquo;s current needs for support, care, education, health, and welfare; (4) Conserve any excess money of the ward for the ward&rsquo;s future needs; provided that if a conservator has been appointed for the estate of the ward, the guardian shall pay the money at least quarterly to the conservator to be conserved for the ward&rsquo;s future needs; (5) Report the condition of the ward and account for money and other assets in the guardian&rsquo;s possession or subject to the guardian&rsquo;s control, as ordered by the court on application of any person interested in the ward&rsquo;s welfare or as required by court rule; and (6) Inform the court of any change in the ward&rsquo;s custodial dwelling or address. [L 2004, c 161, pt of ยง1]
